description: Six young children at a Texas day care center have tested positive for measles — a dreaded scenario with the potential to accelerate an already out-of-control outbreak.
title: Texas measles outbreak nears 500 cases as virus spreads among day care kids

description: Happy Friday, newsletter readers!
title: Three questions on Trump's tariffs: From the Politics Desk

description: Judges showed some frustration this week with how the Trump administration has been defending itself in court, with one saying it appeared to have used "bad faith" tactics, another accusing it of using "disingenuous" arguments and a third saying it was making "inaccurate" claims.
title: 'Bad faith': Judges rip Trump administration for litigation tactics

description: The Trump administration wants to terminate the grants because of what it calls “objectionable DEI material” in the programs they would fund.
title: Supreme Court allows Trump to terminate teacher training grants as part of anti-DEI policy

description: No. 1 UCLA will square off with No. 2 UConn immediately after the first game.
title: Women's Final Four live updates: Texas faces South Carolina in March Madness semifinals

description: A pro-Palestinian protester interrupted a live presentation by Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman, accusing the tech company of selling AI technology to Israel.
title: Pro-Palestinian protester interrupts Microsoft AI CEO during live event

description: NBC News' Christine Romans reports after the stock market closed after another plunge following President Trump's tariff announcement, marking the two worst trading days since March of 2020.
title: Stock market plunges for second straight day after Trump's tariff announcement

description: The Trump administration is creating a new Title IX Special Investigations Team focused on keeping transgender women and girls from sports teams and restrooms designated for females.
title: In latest trans sports salvo, Trump administration creates Title IX investigation team

description: WASHINGTON — Theodore McCarrick, a once-powerful Catholic cardinal who was defrocked by Pope Francis in 2019 after a Vatican investigation determined he sexually molested adults and children, died Friday, according to Archbishop of Washington Robert McElroy.
title: Disgraced former Cardinal Theodore McCarrick has died at age 94

description: Former President Barack Obama said he is "deeply concerned" with some of the actions that President Donald Trump and his administration have taken and seemed to call out the Republican Party for not pushing back on them.
title: Obama says he is 'deeply concerned' with the Trump administration's targeting of students, journalists and law firms

description: A federal judge has ruled that a Maryland man deported to El Salvador due to what officials described as an "administrative error" must be returned to the U.S. by April 7.
title: Judge rules man mistakenly deported to El Salvador must be returned

description: A federal judge ordered the detained Tufts University student Rumeysa Öztürk's petition for her release to be transferred from Massachusetts to Vermont.
title: Tufts student grabbed off street by immigration officers scores legal win, has case moved to Vermont

description: González, who is from Venezuela, hopes to participate in an organ donation program that may help secure a kidney for his brother, who has end-stage renal disease.
title: Venezuelan organ donor reunites with his sick brother after ICE temporary release

description: A three-judge panel of the North Carolina Court of Appeals ruled Friday that more than 65,000 votes cast in the contested race for the state Supreme Court in 2024 must be recounted and verified — a win for the Republican candidate in the razor-thin, disputed contest and a decision that could potentially tip the election results in his favor.
title: New court decision in a disputed North Carolina race means 65,000 votes are a step closer to be being thrown out

description: Warren Buffett went on the record Friday to deny social media posts after President Donald Trump shared on Truth Social a fan video that claimed the president is tanking the stock market on purpose with the endorsement of the legendary investor.
title: Buffett denies social media rumors after Trump shares wild claim that investor backs president crashing market

description: The husband of nursing influencer Hailey Okula said she died of a rare complication after giving birth to their son and first child, Crew.
title: Nursing influencer Hailey Okula died of rare complication after childbirth, husband says

description: Bird flu cases could rise as birds migrate north. But the sweeping cuts to the Department of Health and Human Services include workers focused on the virus.
title: Bird flu could be heading north this spring with fewer federal health officials working to stop it

description: Director and screenwriter Paul Schrader, known for films like "Taxi Driver" and "American Gigolo," has been accused of sexually assaulting and harassing his personal assistant.
title: Filmmaker Paul Schrader accused of reneging on settlement over alleged sexual assault of assistant

description: President Trump has announced a 75-day extension to a deadline that would have ban the social media app TikTok if it is not sold to a non-Chinese buyer.
title: Trump extends deadline on TikTok ban

description: Actor and comedian Russell Brand has posted a video statement stating he is innocent of rape and sexual assault charges filed against him by Britain's Crown Prosecution Service.
title: Russell Brand denies allegations of rape and sexual assault

description: While manufacturers of FDA-approved injectable pentobarbital are warning states not to use the sedative in executions, some states are still buying it — and paying top dollar.
title: An Idaho warden acquired lethal injection drugs from an undisclosed supplier on a rural road

description: Federal prosecutors in New York have added two charges of sex trafficking and transportation to engage in prostitution to their indictment against Sean “Diddy” Combs.
title: One more charge of sex trafficking and one more of prostitution filed against Sean Combs

description: President Donald Trump on Friday said that he will extend the deadline for TikTok's owner to find a non-Chinese buyer by 75 days, averting what could have been another disruption of the app. ByteDance, the Chinese company that owns TikTok, must find a non-Chinese buyer for the app or else it will be banned under a law passed in 2024.
title: Trump extends TikTok deal deadline by 75 days, touts 'tremendous progress'

description: Memphis Grizzlies star Ja Morant is facing a $75,000 fine from the NBA after making finger gun gestures twice during Thursday night's game against the Miami Heat, ignoring NBA warnings from hours earlier.
title: Ja Morant fined $75,000 by NBA for repeated finger gun gestures

description: A man was sentenced to 18 years in jail in New York for running a $24.5 million Ponzi scheme in which he defrauded over 200 victims in sham loan programs and used the money to fund a lifestyle of luxury goods and lavish hotel stays ... while some of his bankrupt victims struggled to pay for chemotherapy expenses.
title: Conman who defrauded over 200 people in $24.5 Ponzi scheme sentenced to 18 years in jail

description: The leader of Haiti’s transitional presidential council tried to allay surging alarm among Haitians over rampant gang violence by acknowledging Thursday that the country has “become hell for everyone” and promising new measures to stop the bloodshed.
title: Haiti taking more steps against gangs after thousands of protesters demand security

description: Seven-time WNBA All-Star Elena Delle Donne, a two-time league MVP and a key part of Washington’s 2019 championship, is retiring after 11 seasons.
title: WNBA star Elena Delle Donne retires after 11 seasons and a championship

description: WASHINGTON — Senate Republicans managed to proceed to debate their massive budget plan Thursday night, but not before an unexpected delay caused by some of their own who have concerns about their strategy on tax cuts and potential cuts to Medicaid.
title: GOP concerns about tax cut strategy and Medicaid loom over Senate budget

description: Nintendo delayed pre-orders for the Switch 2 as the Japanese electronics giant evaluates the impact of President Donald Trump's new, far-reaching tariffs.
title: Nintendo Switch 2 preorders in U.S. delayed because of Trump's tariffs

description: Data about Trump's tariffs suggests the U.S. economy is not ready for a wholesale shift to manufacturing, and that it would take years to ramp up production capabilities.
title: The White House is using tariffs to restore manufacturing. Data suggests it will take time.

description: The attack claimed the life of Austin Metcalf, 17, of Frisco. The victim’s father, said that his son was stabbed in the heart and died in his twin brother’s arms.
title: Suspect in fatal stabbing during Frisco high school track meet: ‘I did it’

description: The U.S. stock market took another nosedive for a second day after President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs on countries around the world.
title: US market plunges for second day after Trump’s sweeping tariffs

description: A federal judge is scheduled to hold a hearing Friday in the case of Kilmar Abrego Garcia, a man the Trump administration admitted it accidentally sent to a notorious megajail in El Salvador.
title: Hearing set for a man Trump administration accidentally sent to notorious El Salvador jail

description: A transgender college student declared “I am here to break the law” before entering a women’s restroom at the Florida State Capitol and being led out in handcuffs by police.
title: Trans student's arrest for violating Florida bathroom law is thought to be a first

description: MILWAUKEE — The Cincinnati Reds’ re-creation of the dead-ball era has them doing something that hadn’t happened in the major leagues in 65 years.
title: The Reds lose their third straight game 1-0, something that hasn't happened in 65 years

description: A man has been arrested for allegedly threatening to bomb the "Saturday Night Live" studios after he messaged the threat to a Connecticut college and an administrator at that college told police, two people briefed on the matter tell NBC News.
title: Suspect arrested for threatening to bomb 'Saturday Night Live' studio, police say

description: A deadly multiday storm system that has unleashed tornadoes and heavy rainfall will continue to batter the Midwest and the mid-South on Friday, in what forecasters describe as a "catastrophic and potentially historic flash flood event."
title: South and Midwest brace for more historic rains and severe flooding in deadly multiday storm system

description: The major U.S. stock indexes dropped sharply Friday trading as President Donald Trump's historic tariffs announcement sent shockwaves through the global economy.
title: Stocks tumble again after China fires back in trade war

description: The United Nations on Thursday named 54 officials from Nicaraguan President Daniel Ortega’s government who it said are responsible for serious human rights violations and crimes, in what was described as a “tightly coordinated system of repression.”
title: Nicaraguan officials committed ‘systematic repression,’ UN says

description: With Wall Street taking a massive hit and experts warning consumer prices will rise even higher amid a growing trade war, NBC’s Brian Cheung joins TODAY to share tips for what you can do with your money, including managing your 401(k), what products to buy now and more.
title: What to do (and not do) with your money amid tariff turmoil

description: Storms and deadly tornadoes have slammed areas of the Midwest and the South for the past week. Now, the same areas are facing a new round of severe weather bringing torrential rain and potentially catastrophic flooding. NBC’s Kathy Park reports and TODAY’s Al Roker tracks the forecast.
title: South and Midwest brace for more historic rain, severe flooding

description: President Donald Trump says his goal for sweeping reciprocal tariffs is to realign the economy by bringing jobs back to the United States. To do that, he’s making products made overseas more expensive. But how much will it cost consumers and how long will it take? NBC’s Tom Costello reports for TODAY.
title: What's the goal of tariffs if it means higher prices in the US?

description: The Trump administration abruptly fired the top two officials, including the director at the National Security Agency, on Thursday. It comes after the White House also fired at least three National Security Council officials after a meeting between President Donald Trump and far-right activist Laura Loomer, who pushed for their firings, telling the president that the officials were disloyal. NBC’s Peter Alexander reports for TODAY.
title: Trump administration fires NSA director, other top security officials

description: Economic fallout is growing after stocks plummeted on Thursday in response to President Donald Trump’s sweeping new reciprocal tariff plan. JP Morgan is now predicting a 60% chance of a global recession if the tariffs continue. NBC’s Christine Romans reports for TODAY.
title: JP Morgan predicts 60% chance of recession if trade war continues

description: UConn, the most successful program in women's college basketball, will look to claim its first national title since 2016 this weekend.
title: Women's Final Four: Will UConn win its first title since 2016?

description: No clear explanation of Trump tariffs strategy. Global markets show signs of worry. Top NSA officials are fired. Women's Final Four. Nintendo Switch 2 unveiled.
title: Trump's mixed tariff messaging and NSA director and deputy fired: Morning Rundown

description: China announced a 34% tariff on all U.S. imports on Friday, escalating trade tensions between the world’s two biggest economies.
title: China hits back at Trump with 34% tariff on U.S. imports

description: President Trump offered support to French far-right leader Marine Le Pen after a Paris court earlier this week convicted her of embezzling European Union funds.
title: Trump says France should 'free' Marine Le Pen as he offers support to far-right leader

description: An investigation is underway after an Amtrak train struck and killed three people who were on the tracks in Bucks County, Pennsylvania, officials said.
title: Amtrak train strikes, kills 3 family members on tracks in Bucks County: Officials

description: Denmark’s prime minister is leaving Greenland after telling the U.S. “you cannot annex another country,” even arguing that international security is at stake.
title: Trump 'cannot annex another country' says Danish leader as she visits Greenland

description: Baseball bat manufacturers had little evidence to suggest a spike in sales was just around the corner when Major League Baseball’s newest season opened last week.
title: Demand for torpedo bats is booming for batmakers

description: The federal government will release the latest monthly jobs report Friday — but in the wake of President Donald Trump’s shock announcement Wednesday seeking to disrupt the global economy with broad tariffs on U.S. imports, the new labor market data for March will essentially end up reflecting a different era.
title: Jobs report expected to show hiring slowed in March ahead of Trump tariffs shock

description: More top vaccine regulators at the FDA have either left or been forced out, which could hobble the agency's ability to approve new vaccines and drugs.
title: 'Decapitated': More top vaccine regulators out at FDA, threatening new approvals

description: A historic ocean liner will become the world’s largest artificial reef once it reaches its final resting place off Florida’s Gulf Coast.
title: Historic ocean liner off Florida’s Gulf Coast will soon be the world’s largest artificial reef

description: In the late fall of 2023, Kristil Krug got a text purporting to be from an old boyfriend and asking if she would like to “hook up” while he was in town.
title: A woman was killed after reporting stalking by an ex. Police say her husband did it

description: Air Force Gen. Timothy Haugh was both the head of U.S. Cyber Command and the director of the NSA since February 2024.
title: National Security Agency chief and deputy director dismissed

description: The initiative backed by Rep. Anna Paulina Luna and publicly opposed by Speaker Mike Johnson has split House Republicans and brought floor proceedings to a halt this week.
title: Trump backs remote voting for new parents amid House GOP impasse
